1260/A0/04/803/003.indicator_name: Number of national institutions with the capacity to prevent and control child trafficking
1260/A0/04/803/003.headline: UNICEF's observers prevented 55 deportation of children to Haiti  and supported to repatriate children erroneously deported. UNICEF supported the training of special forces in child trafficking  and facilitated community mapping for prevention and victims' support.

1260/A0/04/803/003.indicator_name: Laws 137-03 and 136-03 revised  in accordance with international standards and prioritizing the best interest of the child
1260/A0/04/803/003.headline: UNICEF's observers prevented 55 deportation of children to Haiti  and supported to repatriate children erroneously deported. UNICEF supported the training of special forces in child trafficking  and facilitated community mapping for prevention and victims' support.

1260/A0/04/803/003.status_value: The indicator was eliminated as it does not reflect advances in prosecution of the crime or care for the victims.

1260/A0/04/803/002.indicator_name: Percentage of newborns registered in the registrar's office of prioritized hospitals
1260/A0/04/803/002.headline: UNICEF successfully advocated to prioritize birth registration in new Government's Programme. Timely birth registration increased in public hospitals  and the bottlenecks were identified to be babies born to adolescent and foreign mothers.

1260/A0/04/803/002.status_value: No se han desarrollado actividades de registro tardío durante el período.

1260/A0/04/803/004.indicator_name: Number of alternative programmes for incarcerated adolescents functioning in 3 judicial departments
1260/A0/04/803/004.headline: UNICEF provided support to implement alternative measures to the deprivation of liberty of adolescents in conflict with law. Government's insufficient leadership did not allow planned monitoring of the conditions of adolescents' detention centers.
